alert.note: Alert for Casper Mountain; Lander Foothills; Natrona County Lower Elevations; Wind River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued April 01 at 1:54PM MDT until April 04 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy with total snow accumulations of 8 to 12 inches possible across the Wind River Basin. Accumulations 12 to 20 inches possible from Lander to Beaver Rim to Natrona County, including Casper. Casper Mountain could see snow totals of 25 to 35 inches. * WHERE...Wind River Basin, Lander Foothills, Natrona County Lower Elevations and Casper Mountain. * WHEN...From Monday morning through Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible, especially Monday night and Tuesday morning. The combination of snow and wind could create white-out conditions at times. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow may melt during the day, especially on paved surfaces, resulting in accumulations less than forecasted totals.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. Make alternate plans now to avoid traveling Monday and Tuesday.

area.areaDesc: Casper Mountain; Lander Foothills; Natrona County Lower Elevations; Wind River Basin
